intro: Verbascum longicarpum, commonly known as the longpod mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum longicarpum is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects on respiratory ailments.
